positive.title: Craig Wright Will Be Able to Fight Bitcoin Copyright Claim in UK After Winning Appeal
positive.description: Craig Wright, who claims to be Bitcoin inventor Satoshi Nakamoto, will be able to argue his case that the Bitcoin file format should receive copyright protection under UK law after a bench of three UK judges accepted his appeal to a previous court denial, according to a court filing.

positive.title: Ripple effect? Stellar (XLM) is catching up to XRP price gains
positive.description: XLM has turned most overbought since April 2021, boosting risks of a 30% price decline by September.

positive.title: Evidence of crypto usage by ISIS is mounting — TRM Labs
positive.description: Blockchain intelligence platform TRM Labs revealed that USDT on the Tron network is the primary choice for transactions among ISIS affiliates across Asia.

positive.title: Japan Signals More Web3 Promotion Policies Are Coming
positive.description: Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida said on Tuesday that the country plans to improve the environment for Web3 when it comes to using tokens and revitalize the content industry.

positive.title: Through It All, the Bitcoin Mining Industry Looks Set for Growth
positive.description: Though the Bitcoin halving will reduce rewards for miners, the prospects for the industry remain bright and innovations like Ordinals promise more demand for miner services in the future.
